00001 #ifndef MINI_RULES_H
00002 #define MINI_RULES_H
00003 
00004 /* Define a set of rules for creating a variant bam. The syntax is:
00005    all@!isize:[0,800],mapq:[0,60]
00006    region@REGION_FILE
00007    rule1@isize:[0,800],mapq:[0,60]
00008    rule2@!isize[0,800]:mapq[0,60],:ardclip:supplementary:duplicate:qcfail
00009    rule3@
00010    
00011    A file of NA indicates that the rule should be applied genome-wide.
00012    The ordering of the lines sets the hierarchical rule. For instance, a rule on line 2 will be applied 
00013    before a rule on line 3 for all regions that are the union of regions in level 3 and below.
00014    
00015    e.g. Level 3 region file has region chr1   100   1000
00016         Level 2 region file has region chr1   150   1200
00017         The union of these will produce a new region chr1   100   1200, with level 2
00018 */
00019

00033 class Flag {
00034   
00035  public:
00036   Flag() : on(false), off(false), na(true) {}
00037   
00038   void setNA() { on = false; off = false; na = true; } 
00039   void setOn() { on = true; off = false; na = false; } 
00040   void setOff() { on = false; off = true; na = false; } 
00041 
00042   bool isNA()  const { return na; } 
00043   bool isOn()  const { return on; } 
00044   bool isOff() const { return off; } 
00045 
00046   // return true if modified
00047   bool parseRuleLine(string &val, regex &reg);
00048 
00049  private: 
00050   bool on;
00051   bool off; 
00052   bool na;
00053 
00054 };
00055 
00056 // hold a range of valid numeric values (e.g. isize). 
00057 // can optionally invert the range to make rule the complement of the range
00058 struct Range {
00059 
00060   Range() : min(0), max(0), inverted(false), pattern("") {}
00061   Range(int mn, int mx, int in, string p) : min(mn), max(mx), inverted(in), pattern(p) {}
00062   ~Range() {}
00063 
00064   int min;
00065   int max;
00066   bool inverted;
00067   string pattern;
00068   bool every = true;
00069   bool none = false;
00070   
00071   bool isValid(int val) {
00072     if (every)
00073       return true;
00074     if (none)
00075       return true;
00076     if (!inverted)
00077       return (val >= min && val <= max);
00078     else
00079       return (val < min || val > max);
00080   }
00081 
00082   void parseRuleLine(string line);
00083 
00084   friend ostream& operator<<(ostream &out, const Range &r);
00085 
00086   // set that this ranges accepts everything
00087   void setEvery() {
00088     every = true;
00089     none = false;
00090   }
00091 
00092   // set that this range accepts nothing
00093     void setNone() {
00094     every = false;
00095     none = true;
00096    }
00097   
00098   // return if this range accepts all values
00099   bool isEvery() const { return every; }
00100   
00101   // return if this range accepts no values
00102   bool isNone() const { return none; }
00103 
00104 
00105 };

00107 // a container to hold boolean rules based mostly on alignment flag
00108 struct FlagRule {
00109   
00110   FlagRule() {
00111     dup  = Flag();
00112     supp       = Flag();
00113     qcfail     = Flag();
00114     hardclip   = Flag();
00115     fwd_strand = Flag();
00116     rev_strand = Flag();
00117     mate_fwd_strand = Flag();
00118     mate_rev_strand = Flag();
00119     mapped          = Flag();
00120     mate_mapped     = Flag();
00121     ff = Flag();
00122     fr = Flag();
00123     rf = Flag();
00124     rr = Flag();
00125     ic = Flag();
00126   }
00127   
00128 
00132   /*bool inline flagCheck(Flag &f, bam1_t *b, int bamflag, bool inv) {
00133     
00134     if (!f.isNA()) {
00135       bool val = (b->core.flag & bamflag);
00136       if ( (f.isOff() && val) || (f.isOn() && !val))
00137         return inv ? false : true;
00138     }
00139     return true; 
00140     }*/
00141 
00142   Flag dup, supp, qcfail, hardclip, fwd_strand, rev_strand,
00143     mate_fwd_strand, mate_rev_strand, mapped, mate_mapped, ff, fr, rf, rr, ic;
00144 
00145   bool na = true;
00146   void parseRuleLine(string line);
00147   
00148   // ask whether a read passes the rule
00149   bool isValid(Read &r);
00150 
00151   friend ostream& operator<<(ostream &out, const FlagRule &fr);
00152 
00153   // set every flag to NA (most permissive)
00154   void setEvery() {
00155     dup.setOn();
00156     supp.setOn();
00157     qcfail.setOn();
00158     hardclip.setOn();
00159     fwd_strand.setOn();
00160     rev_strand.setOn();
00161     mate_fwd_strand.setOn();
00162     mate_rev_strand.setOn();
00163     mapped.setOn();
00164     mate_mapped.setOn();
00165     ff.setOn();
00166     fr.setOn();
00167     rf.setOn();
00168     rr.setOn();
00169     ic.setOn();
00170     na = true;
00171   }
00172 
00173   // set every flag to OFF everythign off)
00174   void setNone() {
00175     dup.setOff();
00176     supp.setOff();
00177     qcfail.setOff();
00178     hardclip.setOff();
00179     fwd_strand.setOff();
00180     rev_strand.setOff();
00181     mate_fwd_strand.setOff();
00182     mate_rev_strand.setOff();
00183     mapped.setOff();
00184     mate_mapped.setOff();
00185     ff.setOff();
00186     fr.setOff();
00187     rf.setOff();
00188     rr.setOff();
00189     ic.setOff();
00190   }
00191 
00192 
00193   // ask if every flag is set to NA (most permissive)
00194   bool isEvery() const { return na; }
00195 
00196 };

00199 class AbstractRule {
00200 
00201  public:
00202 
00203   AbstractRule() {}
00204   ~AbstractRule() {
00205     free(atm);
00206   }
00207 
00208   string name = "";
00209   Range isize = {-1, -1, true, "isize"}; // include all
00210   Range mapq =  {-1, -1, true, "mapq"}; 
00211   Range len =   {-1, -1, true, "length"};
00212   Range clip =  {-1, -1, true, "clip"};
00213   Range phred = {-1, -1, true, "phred"};
00214   Range nm = {-1, -1, true, "nm"};
00215   Range nbases = {-1,-1,true, "nbases"};
00216   Range ins = {-1,-1,true, "ins"};
00217   Range del = {-1,-1,true, "del"};
00218   unordered_map<string,bool> orientation;
00219 
00220   AC_AUTOMATA_t * atm = 0;
00221   string atm_file;
00222   bool atm_inv = false;
00223   size_t atm_count = 0;
00224   
00225   int subsample = 100;
00226 
00227   bool none = false;
00228   // set to true if you want a read to belong to the region if its mate does
00229   //bool mate = false; 
00230 
00231   FlagRule fr;
00232 
00233   bool isValid(Read &r);
00234 
00235   void parseRuleLine(string line);
00236 
00237   void parseSubLine(string line);
00238 
00239   bool ahomatch(const string& seq);
00240 
00241   bool ahomatch(const char * seq, unsigned len);
00242 
00243   void parseSeqLine(string line);
00244 
00245   friend ostream& operator<<(ostream &out, const AbstractRule &fr);
00246 
00247   void setEvery() {
00248     isize.setEvery();
00249     mapq.setEvery();
00250     len.setEvery();
00251     clip.setEvery();
00252     phred.setEvery();
00253     nm.setEvery();
00254     nbases.setEvery();
00255     fr.setEvery();
00256     atm = NULL;
00257     subsample = 100;
00258   }
00259   
00260   void setNone() { 
00261     isize.setNone();
00262     mapq.setNone();
00263     len.setNone();
00264     clip.setNone();
00265     phred.setNone();
00266     nm.setNone();
00267     nbases.setNone();
00268     fr.setNone();
00269     none = true;
00270   }
00271 
00272   // return if this rule accepts all reads
00273   bool isEvery() const {
00274     return isize.isEvery() && mapq.isEvery() && len.isEvery() && clip.isEvery() && phred.isEvery() && nm.isEvery() && nbases.isEvery() && fr.isEvery() && (atm != 0) && (subsample == 100);
00275   }
00276 
00277   // return if this rule accepts no reads
00278   bool isNone() const {
00279     return none;
00280     //return isize.isNone() && mapq.isNone() && len.isNone() && clip.isNone() && phred.isNone() && nm.isNone() && fr.isNone();
00281   }
00282 
00283 
00284 };

00300

00304

00306     return m_abstract_rules.size();
00307   }
00308   
00309  private:
00310

00318

00320 
00321   // rule applies to mate too
00322   bool m_applies_to_mate = false;
00323

00325   int m_count = 0;

00329 // a hierarchy of mini rules to operate on
00330 class MiniRulesCollection {
00331 
00332  public: 
00333   MiniRulesCollection() {}
00334   ~MiniRulesCollection() {
00335     for (auto& i : m_regions)
00336       delete(i);
00337     
00338   }
00339   MiniRulesCollection(string file);
00340 
00341   string isValid(Read &r);
00342   
00343   friend ostream& operator<<(ostream& out, const MiniRulesCollection &mr);
00344   
00345   void sendToBed(string file);
00346 
00347   // check if we should do the whole genome
00348   bool hasWholeGenome() const {
00349     for (auto it : m_regions)
00350       if (it->m_whole_genome)
00351         return true;
00352     return false;
00353   }
00354 
00355   GenomicRegionVector sendToGrv() const;
00356 
00357   size_t size() const { return m_regions.size(); } 
00358 
00359   size_t numRules() const {
00360     size_t num = 0;
00361     for (auto it : m_regions)
00362       num += it->size();
00363     return num;
00364   }
00365  private:
00366 
00367   vector<MiniRules*> m_regions;
00368   
00369 };
